document.docAuthor: Kilgallen, Niamh M. & Lowry, James K.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the scopelocheirid amphipods (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Lysianassoidea), with the description of new taxa from Australian waters

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the scopelocheirid amphipods (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Lysianassoidea), with the description of new taxa from Australian waters

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Australian Museum Research Institute, 6 College Street, Sydney, NSW 2010, Australia
Australian Museum Research Institute, 6 College Street, Sydney, NSW 2010, Australia

figureCitation.captionText: Figure 8. Distribution of Scopelocheirus crenatus Bate, 1957, and its synonyms. Circles represent records of Scopelocheirus crenatus and its objective synonyms; triangle represents the subjective synonym Tryphosa sera Meinert, 1890. Type localities are indicated by the corresponding open symbol.

Figure 9. Scopelocheirus crenatus Bate. Female, 8.0 mm; male, 7.8 mm; AM P. 35895, Skipness Point, Clyde Sea area, Scotland. Scales for antennae, gnathopods, pereopods represent 0.5 mm; remainder represent 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Scopelocheirus crenatus Bate, 1857: 138. - Stebbing 1906 : 62. - Stephensen 1923a : 96. - Stephensen 1923b : 16. - Stephensen 1932 : 355. - Chevreux 1935 : 41, pl. 7, fig. 3. - Stephensen 1935 : 77. - Raitt 1937 : 249. - Stephensen 1940 : 12. - Stephensen 1942 : 472 (table). - Jones 1948 : 404, 421. - Enequist 1949 : 387 (table). - Jones 1951 : 138, 143 (appendix). - Gurjanova 1951 : 241 (key), 242 (fig. 107). - J.L. Barnard 1958 : 99 (list). - Thurston and Allen 1969 : 367. - Laverack and Blackler 1974 : 81. - Mattson 1981 : 115 (table 1). - Palerud and Vader 1991 : 43.

Callisoma crenata . - Bate 1862 : 85, pl. 14, fig. 5. - Bate and Westwood 1863 : 120, text fig. - Norman 1869 : 276. - Boeck 1871 : 101. - Boeck 1872 : 132, pl. 7, fig. 1. -
M'Intosh 1874
: 266. - Haddon 1886 : 636. - Chevreux 1888 : 4. - Robertson 1888 : 23. - Pocock 1889 : 431. - G.O. Sars 1890 : 53, pl. 19, fig. 1. - Meinert 1890 : 151. - Walker 1892 : 137. - Walker 1895 : 291. - Walker 1896 : 45. - Scott 1898 : 176. - Scott 1900 : 180. - Nordgaard 1905 : 183. - Nordgaard 1911 : 21. - Chumley 1918 : [page unknown].
Atlantic Ocean : 3.7-323 m ( Laverack and Blackler 1974 , Enequist 1949 ). Mediterranean Sea : 2500 m ( Chevreux 1935 ).
In the literature, this species name has been widely recorded from the north-east Atlantic Ocean, with a single record from the Mediterranean Sea.
Mediterranean Sea. France : Off Corsica ( Chevreux 1935 ).

caption.paragraph:
Figure 8. Distribution of
Scopelocheirus crenatus
Bate, 1957, and its synonyms. Circles represent records of
Scopelocheirus crenatus
and its objective synonyms; triangle represents the subjective synonym
Tryphosa sera
Meinert, 1890. Type localities are indicated by the corresponding open symbol.

Figure 9.
Scopelocheirus crenatus
Bate. Female, 8.0 mm; male, 7.8 mm; AM P.35895, Skipness Point, Clyde Sea area, Scotland. Scales for antennae, gnathopods, pereopods represent 0.5 mm; remainder represent 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: A scavenger that has been collected in baited traps ( Chevreux 1935 ) and from dead fish on fishermen's lines ( Sars 1890 ).

We follow Stebbing (1906) and consider
Tryphosa serra
Meinert, 1890 to be a possible junior subjective synonym of
Scopelocheirus crenatus
. The record of Chevreux (1935) from off Corsica is the only known record of this species from the Mediterranean and is an order of magnitude deeper than all the Atlantic records. It may be a misidentification of
Scopelocheirus polymedus
Bellan-Santini, 1984.
